articles.author: Simon Lewis, Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: After weeks of intensive diplomacy aimed at securing a ceasefire between Israel and Hezbollah militants, the United States has settled on an altogether different approach: let the unfolding conflict in Lebanon play out.
articles.title: Caught between competing goals in Lebanon, US stays on the sidelines

articles.author: Dave Sherwood
articles.description: Nobody is sure how many Cubans seeking U.S. shores are lost among the strong currents, treacherous weather and shark-infested waters of the Florida Straits.
articles.title: Cubans are disappearing at sea in migrant exodus, leaving a painful void

articles.author: Daniel Leussink, Irene Wang
articles.description: Visitors to the memorial park for Hiroshima's atomic bombing said they hoped Friday's Nobel Peace Prize for Japan's atomic bomb survivors would boost efforts for world peace and spur world leaders to visit the site.
articles.title: In Hiroshima peace park, visitors hope Nobel win will boost peace efforts

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Vice President Kamala Harris, the Democratic presidential nominee, plans to make her medical information public on Saturday in an effort to draw attention to Republican rival Donald Trump's refusal to do so, according to a Harris aide.
articles.title: Harris to release medical report, drawing contrast with Trump

articles.author: Fatos Bytyci
articles.description: Persistent ethnic tension in north Kosovo could trigger a repeat of violence seen in the area last year, when four people died in a gun battle and NATO peacekeepers were hurt in clashes, a senior official from the military alliance warned on Saturday.
articles.title: North Kosovo ethnic tensions remain risk for violence, NATO official says

articles.author: Laurie Chen, Xiaoyu Yin
articles.description: Over a thousand Taiwanese pilgrims flocked to southeast China's Fujian province this week for a religious festival, a rare instance of cross-strait cultural exchanges that threatens to be overshadowed by political tensions.
articles.title: Taiwanese flock to China religious festival despite tensions

articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Alexander Cornwell
articles.description: Israeli strikes killed 22 people and injured more than 100 in central Beirut on Thursday, Lebanese authorities said, as a senior Hezbollah official evaded an Israeli assassination attempt in the city, according to three security sources.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill 22 in Beirut as Hezoballah leader evades assassination

articles.author: Iryna Nazarchuk
articles.description: In a town without basements, residents of Ukraine's "Venice" on the Danube have no way to hide underground from the increasingly frequent Russian drone attacks on the country's river and deep sea ports.
articles.title: Ukraine's "Venice" in Danube delta faces relentless Russian drone attacks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Turkish Foreign Minister Hakan Fidan will visit Greece to discuss and find solutions to bilateral issues, including maritime zones and airspace, Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan said on Saturday.
articles.title: Turkish Foreign Minister to visit Greece to discuss bilateral issues

articles.author: Adam Makary, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Thousands of people are trapped in Gaza's Jabalia camp as Israeli forces attack the area, Médecins Sans Frontières (Doctors Without Borders) said on Friday, a week after Israel began an offensive it says is aimed at stopping Hamas regrouping.
articles.title: Thousands said trapped in Jabalia camp as Israel escalates attacks in northern Gaza
